steps.heading: Take nearby neutral control
steps.body: Drag from your stronghold to a neutral tower, then keep packets flowing so your economy starts early.
goals: Create your first outgoing link.
Capture one neutral tower quickly.
Hold both towers through the first assault.

steps.heading: Stage from the midpoint
steps.body: Long routes delay reinforcements. Use forward towers as staging points before committing deeper pushes.
goals: Capture a midpoint tower first.
Send follow-up packets from the closer tower.
Keep pressure on both offense and defense.

steps.heading: Defend two lanes at once
steps.body: Do not dump all troops into one side. Split attention and keep reserve packets ready for emergencies.
goals: Maintain links into both active lanes.
Keep reserve troops in at least one backline tower.
Recover quickly if one flank weakens.

steps.heading: Thin swarm waves early
steps.body: Swarm enemies are weak individually but dangerous in large groups. Intercept before they stack.
goals: Contest swarm lanes early.
Prefer short links for faster response.
Prevent a single lane from snowballing.

steps.heading: Focus durable targets
steps.body: Tank units absorb pressure. Collapse multiple links onto one threat before extending farther.
goals: Focus-fire one tank at a time.
Use newly captured towers as rally points.
Avoid overextending during tank pushes.

steps.heading: Push during shield downtime
steps.body: Shield formations are strongest during active barrier windows. Time bursts between cycles.
goals: Wait for shield downtime before committing.
Send burst waves instead of trickle pressure.
Rebuild reserves between enemy cycles.

steps.heading: Eliminate support first
steps.body: Support units amplify nearby enemies. Prioritize them to collapse the enemy formation.
goals: Identify support units early.
Target support before tank or shield escorts.
Use split pressure to isolate support lines.

steps.heading: Stabilize your cluster
steps.body: Connected territory gives strong bonuses. Secure your cluster before chasing isolated objectives.
goals: Build a connected friendly cluster.
Hold cluster stability under pressure.
Only then contest isolated towers.

steps.heading: Stabilize faster than usual
steps.body: Wave windows are shorter in this mission. Early hesitation creates cascading pressure.
goals: Capture your early nodes quickly.
Fortify as soon as ownership flips.
Spend reserves before pressure spikes.

steps.heading: Maintain redundant routes
steps.body: Disruptors punish fragile networks. Keep alternate paths to critical towers.
goals: Create two paths to key towers.
Re-link quickly when routes break.
Avoid single-point failures in frontline lanes.

steps.heading: Intercept at safe points
steps.body: Splitters multiply pressure when they break in bad locations. Control where fights happen.
goals: Hold center interception positions.
Destroy splitters before tower range when possible.
Prevent child units from branching both lanes.

steps.heading: Track boss phases and telegraphs
steps.body: Boss attacks are telegraphed. Reposition force before each impact and keep reserve for adds.
goals: React to telegraphed boss attacks.
Preserve reserves for reinforcement surges.
Survive all boss phase transitions.
